ApptainerApp.description:
Represents an Apptainer application or set of applications using a single image.

This uses Apptainer to deploy a portable image of the desired container. Multiple
entrypoints can be specified to allow different commands to be run on the same
container image.

app_type.description: An Apptainer (executable container image) with multiple potential entrypoints
app_type.title: App Type

entrypoints.description: List of executables to run using the Apptainer
entrypoints.title: Entrypoints

global_options.description: Global options that apply to all Entrypoints

ApptainerApp.title: ApptainerApp

BinaryApp.description:
Represents a standalone Binary application.

This will fetch a standalone binary, validate its hash and add its
location to the path.

app_type.description: A standalone binary to be downloaded and added to the path
app_type.title: App Type

name.description: Name of executable to use after loading the Module
name.title: Name

url.description: URL to download the binary from
url.title: Url

hash_type.description: Type of hash used to check the binary

BinaryApp.title: BinaryApp

path.description: Image URL excluding the version/tag. Must be a valid URL as described here: https://apptainer.org/docs/user/main/cli/apptainer_pull.html#synopsis
path.title: Path

version.description: Version or tag of the docker image
version.title: Version

DeploymentSettings.description: All global configuration settings for the Deployment.

default_versions.description: Mapping of [module-name]:[version] to use as default when no version is specified in a `module load` command. If no default is specified, deploy-tools will use natsort to place e.g. 1.2 after all alpha, beta and rc candidates as described here: https://natsort.readthedocs.io/en/7.1.1/examples.html#sorting-more-expressive-versioning-schemes

DeploymentSettings.title: DeploymentSettings

Entrypoint.description:
Represents an entrypoint to a command on the Apptainer image.

If no command is provided, the entrypoint (`name`) is used by default. This
corresponds to the name of the executable provided by the Module.

name.description: Name of executable to use after loading the Module
name.title: Name

command.description: Command to run in container. Defaults to `name`
command.title: Command

Entrypoint.title: Entrypoint

apptainer_args.description: Apptainer arguments to pass when launching the container
apptainer_args.title: Apptainer Args

command_args.description: Arguments to pass to command entrypoint
command_args.title: Command Args

mounts.description: A list of mount points to add to the container in the form of 'host_path[:container_path[:opts]]' where opts (mount options) can be 'ro' or 'rw' and defaults to 'rw'
mounts.title: Mounts

host_binaries.description: A list of host binaries to mount into the container. These are discovered on the host using the current PATH and are mounted into the container at /usr/bin/[binary_name]
host_binaries.title: Host Binaries

EnvVar.description: Represents an environment variable to set when loading the Module.
EnvVar.title: EnvVar

HashType.description: Type of hash to use for the binary.
HashType.title: HashType

Module.description:
Represents a Module to be deployed.

Modules can optionally include a set of applications, environment variables to load,
and a list of module dependencies.

name.description: Name of module to use when loading
name.title: Name

version.description: Version of this module. This cannot include spaces, cannot start with a full stop and the filename must match as `[version].yaml`
version.title: Version

description.description: Description that can be read with the `module whatis [module-name]` command
description.title: Description

env_vars.description: List of environment variables to set when loading module
env_vars.title: Env Vars

applications.description: Applications to be included in Module
applications.title: Applications

allow_updates.description: Allow updates to this module version after initial deployment
allow_updates.title: Allow Updates

exclude_from_defaults.description: Exclude this module version from being automatically set as default, but you can still manually set it. This is used for e.g. alphas
exclude_from_defaults.title: Exclude From Defaults

load_script.description: Provide list of commands that are run on module load. You need to add `system` before any bash command (e.g. `system ls /dir`), as Modulefiles otherwise use Tcl. This field should be used carefully; please speak to a deploy-tools admin before use
load_script.title: Load Script

unload_script.description: Provide list of commands that are run on module unload. You need to add `system` before any bash command (e.g. `system ls /dir`), as Modulefiles otherwise use Tcl. This field should be used carefully; please speak to a deploy-tools admin before use
unload_script.title: Unload Script

Module.title: Module

ModuleDependency.description:
Specify an Environment Module to include as a dependency.

If the dependent Environment Module is managed by this same Deployment (i.e. is a
Module), you must specify a specific version in order to pass validation.

version.description: Version of dependency. Will use default if none specified, but this is only valid for modules not managed using deploy-tools
version.title: Version

ModuleDependency.title: ModuleDependency

Release.description: Represents a Module along with its lifecycle (deprecation) status.

deprecated.description: Whether this Module version is deprecated
deprecated.title: Deprecated

Release.title: Release

ShellApp.description:
Represents a Shell application.

This will run the code specified as a shell script. This currently uses Bash for
improved functionality while retaining high compatibility with various Linux
distributions.

app_type.description: A shell application with the given script
app_type.title: App Type

name.description: Name of executable to use after loading the Module
name.title: Name

ShellApp.title: ShellApp

description:
Configuration for all Modules and Applications that should be deployed.

This will include any deprecated Modules.
title: Deployment
